reviews.text: The W in Istanbul is truly an excellent hotel!
reviews.title: Istanbul W - Excellent hotel, even better staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are big, bathrooms great. The gym is small but enough brand new equipment for a decent hotel workout.
reviews.title: In Istanbul, W = WONDERFUL!

likes.liked: — The people, the rooms, the bed, and the neighborhood.

reviews.title: I Write Because I Love Trip Advisor
reviews.text: The staff cannot do more to help you.. very personal warm feelings from everyone!
Very trendy common areas, the lounge bar is packed on Wednesday and Saturday nights with the posh crowd, great vibe!
reviews.title: Marvelous experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have been to a few of the big hotels in Istanbul, and will only return to the W!
reviews.title: Unique and Cool!

reviews.text: Great chic and trendy rooms with a hip crowd, cool large rooms and the restaurant was amazing. You have to try the restaurant. The only problm I thought was that the hotel has way too much staff and they are in your face and in your way all the time, but I guess thats beter then being shot staffed.
reviews.title: Awesome decor and experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first experience in a W hotel and I have to say it was absolute great! I have stayed in other 5 star hotels (mainly in Dubai) but this was had a different taste, it was funky, cool and sexy!
reviews.title: The W Experience Was Wonderfull!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As said in other reviews the staff in this hotel are absolutely friendly and helpful. We had an early check-in and a late checkout! Upgraded our room which had a beautiful and big terrace! Rooms are big, spacey, clean but one thing which was missing was an electronic kettle?
reviews.title: The W Istanbul - Truly Wonderful!

likes.disliked: — Slightly removed from the centre and old town of Istanbul

reviews.text: The in-room dining had fabulous tasty food! Although drinks are quite expensive all around the hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel and amazng service

reviews.text: I do recommend the spice market restaurant had a great noodle there as it had been a while since the last time I had one.
reviews.title: Nice Neighbourhood surrounding area! Good service!

reviews.text: Family trip to Istanbul from April 11-16, 2009. The W hotel is relatively new and many taxi drivers could not find it. Carry one of the hotel's address card, since many taxi drivers do not speak english. The hotel is new and nice but the overall dark lighting and ambiance is geared more for the younger crowd, ie less than 35. The hotel has a full size grocery, called Migros, just around the corner; very convenient. W also provides free internet in the 2nd floor lounge. Going to the hotel from the airport, there are many people just outside of customs that want to take you there but their quotes were almost twice that of the taxis that were waiting outside. So, just go straight out. We paid about $25US for a 30 minute ride. The hotel folks are very helpful. From the hotel, you can walk (10 minutes) to the first tram stop, which is Kabatas. For 1.40 TL, you can go one way to all the tourist areas, ie Sultanhamet square, Spice Bazaar, etc... Adjacent to the Blue Mosque is the Arasta Bazaar. Inside the Arasta Bazaar, is the travel agency Senkron. We paid 30 euros per adult and 15 euros per child to do a private boat trip on the Bosphorous. It included a ride to some famous cafe at the peak of a mountain which overlooked the Goldenhorn river. I'd recommend this trip.
reviews.title: W hotel and general Istanbul review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were among the first guests at the hotel and it was great. The location isn't bad, but it's such a comfortable haven in the middle of Istanbul. Cem at the concierge desk picked out some great nightlife options for us. Loved it.
reviews.title: they got it right from the start

reviews.text: we just returned from a stay at the W hotel and we loved it. Very nice staff and very service minded. The hotel looks great, a lot of attention to details and funky, loungy experience. A tad dark at first sight, but thats the W look. The hotel is located in Besiktas - 10 min taxi drive away from the old centre. The dolmebace palace is a 15mins stroll away where you can catch the modern tram going to old instanbul. The rooms are very nicely fit, but they are not sound proof - noices from next room are very loud especially in connecting rooms ! Very nice bar, but prices seem overcharged. All in all, a very nice place to stay. Not very suited for kids.
reviews.title: Our W stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just returned from a 4 night stay at W. This hotel is a bit out of the way if you want to visit the old part of Istanbul, although by day 3 we had cracked which ferry, tram etc to get us there and back fairly speedily. Loved the bed, so comfy and we had a wonderful dinner at The Spice Market [hotel restaurant]. Fantastic staff, very helpful and friendly, particulary the consierge. They knew it was my husband's birthday on our last evening and brought a cake to our room with candle and birthday card signed by the staff.
reviews.title: Fantastic staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The W is a very hip place and the staff was just fantastic. We watched the moon rise one night from the bar on the second floor.
reviews.title: Hip place but out of the way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Please see our last review - this is only for photos.
reviews.title: Some pics to go with our review ---

reviews.text: I personally dont like the "darkness" of the Ws. But, once you get used to the darkness, the W, Istanbul is a gem. The hotel is all about service - from the manager (who has personally come to see me everytime I have checked in), the receptionists, the porters everyone is service oriented. The conceirge manager is exceptionally good - you should meet him and he makes all your plans. The restaurant is good, but overpriced. You can get all the chain restaurants within a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The best (quickest) way to get around the hotel (to city) is if you take a taxi to Besiktas and then take the funicular.
reviews.title: Service, Service, Service ...

reviews.text: We stayed at the "W" Istanbul in July 2008. It is a gorgeous old building that is very well restored. The staff are fantastic and look after your every whim. We had some taxi issues while in Istanbul (being taken for a ride in all senses). However, when someone from the hotel got us a cab, there were never any problems. Part of the problem is that the hotel is a good bit out of way (15 min walk from the tram terminal), and a relatively new hotel, so taxi drivers didn't have a clue where they were going.
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel just a tad out of town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other than the hotel being a bit off the beaten track, it is a treat to walk in to attentive staff, a great concierge and fabulous decor.
reviews.title: Above and beyond

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't comment on the value, as we stayed on Starwood points.
reviews.title: Really Couldn't ask for more
